entity_model_features.title: Entity Model Features
entity_model_features.config.substitute_:
EMF will try to replace missing part in the .jem
 model file with the vanilla counterpart
entity_model_features.config.debug.toolt: Debug options, can be helpful to figure some things out
Prints model creation debug data to the log
entity_model_features.config.vanilla_ren:
This setting will render the vanilla model alongside the custom one for comparison
It will not animate and thus might be positioned a bit weird
entity_model_features.config.log_math.to:
Prints animation math debug data to the log
WARNING EXTREMELY LAG INDUCING!
entity_model_features.config.options.too: Various options for fundamental features or mod compatibility fixes
entity_model_features.config.tools.toolt: Optional tools to help with model making or distinguishing custom models
entity_model_features.config.force_model: Try to prevent EMF models being overridden

Will try and force entity renderers to use the models set by EMF
 this can override vanilla models changed by other mods
 this wont work with all mods
this will print out the part information or a complete .jem file
for any model that EMF can access
The .jem files can be found in "MC_DIRECTORY/emf/export" after a reload
The .jem files are Blockbench ready with
correct pivots boxes and uvs
Unknown models refers to models not supported by OptiFine CEM
entity_model_features.config.physics.too:
Will only render the original vanilla model parts on death if physics mod is enabled
 this partially works but is not a perfect solution
entity_model_features.config.update.tool:
Sets how often a mobs model will
update for changes like health & age
Never = never update
Slow = 3-5 seconds
Average = about 1 second
Fast = less than a second
Instant = instant (possible lag with hundred of mobs)
entity_model_features.config.texture_ove:
This controls how EMF handles rendering sub-models that have an override texture set
for example if a creeper model has a separate texture for the head sub-model
There are two ways to do this, rely on my code, or rely on a quirk of the Iris mod
My code 'works' but I am not an expert with render buffers and it may cause issues
The Iris quirk uses a pretty straightforward and seemingly safe/stable method but i'm told its not intended Iris behaviour
The Iris option will default to the EMF code if Iris isn't installed
this should almost always be left on default except when debugging texture overrides in sub-models
entity_model_features.config.debug_right: Show EMF debug data on entity right click

If enabled, this will print out EMf debug info into
the log and chat when an entity is right clicked.
entity_model_features.config.lod.tooltip:
Sets the distance at which animations will begin to skip frames,
lower the Level of Detail (LOD), This can help with performance
None = no frame skipping
16 = will skip 1 frame for every 16 blocks distance from player
Lower numbers mean more skipped frames and more performance gain
but of course animations will become more noticeably lower
framerate the closer the LOD distance is set
entity_model_features.config.low_fps_lod:
If enabled this will reduce the Level of Detail (LOD)
impact of the above setting according to your fps.
Only applies when below 60 fps as skipped frames
become increasingly noticeable at lower fps
entity_model_features.config.render.tool:
Changes how custom model parts are rendered, this does not affect vanilla model parts.
Normal = normal rendering
Flash green = the custom parts will flash green
Outlines = the outlines of the model parts will render
Disabled = custom model parts will not render
entity_model_features.config.animate_onc:
On by default
this setting makes it so entity models will animate only once per each entity rendered
this will be entirely normal in game however mobs visible in
 inventory screens may flicker weirdly
 especially if it represents a real mob in the world you can already see
entity_model_features.config.ebe_config_:
If enabled, this will allow EMF to modify the EBE Mod's config
to disable EBE for certain block entities if that
Block Entity actually has a custom EMF model loaded.
EMF cannot automatically re enable these settings afterwards,
 you will have to do that manually if desired.
